p.hi: Made by the Reuer. Fa. Iames Ledeſma of the Society of Ieſus.

div.head: IESVS MARIA.
OF the name and ſigne of a Chriſtian. Chap. 1.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Are you a Chriſtian?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea, by the grace of our Lorde Ieſus Chriſt.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is a Chriſtian?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Diſciple of Chriſt: that is he which hauing bene baptized beleeueth and maketh open profeſſion of his law.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you vnderſtand Chriſt to be?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He is trew God and trew man.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Which is the ſigne of a Chriſtian?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
The ſigne of the holy Croſſe, which is made by putting the hād
vnto the head, & vnder the breaſt, and thē at the lefte ſhoulder, and the right, ſaying. In the name of the Father and of the Sonne & of the holy Ghoſt. Amen.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Why is it made in this manner?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: To ſignifie vnto vs two great miſteries. the one of the moſt holy Trinity: the other of the Incarnatiō of our Lord Ieſus Chriſt who died for vs vpon the Croſſe.

div.head: Of the end of man and neceſſary things for a Chriſtian. Chap. 2.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For what end was man created?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: For to loue and ſerue God in this life: and afterward, for to ſee him and enioy him in the other life.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: How many thinges are neceſſary for a Chriſtian that he may attaine his end, and be ſaued?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Fower. Faith, Hope, Charity, & good workes.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you beleeue by Faith?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: All that which the holy Catholick Roman Church beleeueth & holdeth: and principally, that which is contained in the Creed.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the Creed.

sp.speaker: D.

p.hi: 1 Credo in Deum Patrem omnipotentem, creatorem coeli & terrae.
2 Et in Ieſum Chriſtum, filium eius vnicum, Dominum noſtrum.
3 Qui conceptus est de ſpiritu ſancto natus ex Maria Virgine.
4 Paſſus ſub Pontio Pilato, crucifixus, mortuus & ſepultus.
5 Deſcendit ad inferos, tertia die reſurrexit a mortuis.
6 Aſcendit ad coelos, ſedet ad dexteram Dei patris omnipotentis.
7 Inde venturus est iudicare viuos & mortuos.
8 Gredo in Spiritum ſanctum.
9 Sanctam Eccleſiam Catholicam, Sanctorum communionem.
10 Remiſſionem peccatorum.
11 Carnis reſurrectionem.
12 Vitam aeternam. Amen.

sp.p: 1 I Beleeue in God the Father Almighty, maker of heauē & earth.
2 And in Ieſus Chriſt, his onely Sonne our Lord.
3 Which was cōceiued by the holy Ghoſt, borne of the Virgine Mary.
4 Suffered vnder Pontius Pilate, was crucified, dead and buried.
5 He deſcended into Hel, the third day he roſe againe from the dead.
6 He aſcended into Heauen, and ſitteth at the right hand of God the Father Almighty.
7 From thence he ſhall come to iudge the quicke and the dead.
8 I beleeue in the holy Ghoſt.
9 The holy Catholicke Church: the communion of Saintes.
10 The forgiueneſſe of Sinnes.
11 The reſurrection of the fleſh.
12 And the life euerlaſting. Amen.

div.head: OF the Creed Chap. 3.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What haue we ſaied?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Creed.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who made it?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The twelue Apoſtles, whan they were to go for to preach the goſpell through all the world.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Wherfore did they make it?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: For to inſtruct vs in Faith.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is conteined in the Creed?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Twelue articles: that is, twelue principall partes of our faith.

div.head: An expoſition of ſome principall articles of the Creede. Chap. 4.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: In whome do you beleeue?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: I beleeue in God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He is the Creatour and gouernour of heauen and earth, and Lord of all thinges.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Why is God ſaid to be almighty?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Becauſe with his very will onely and infinite power he can make and deſtroy euery thing.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you beleeue that the moſt holy Trinity is?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It is that very ſame God, the Father, the Sonne, & the holy ghoſt three perſons, & one onely God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Is the Father God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea forſooth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Is the Sonne God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea forſooth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Is the holy ghoſt God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea forſooth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Be there three Gods?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: No forſooth. For although there be three perſons, yet is there but one onely God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What ſimilitude can you geue me of the moſt holy Trinity?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Euen as we that are made according to his image and likeneſſe, haue one onely ſoule, and three powers therof: memory, vnderſtanding, and will.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Do you beleeue in Ieſus Chriſt?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea forſooth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you thinke Ieſus Chriſt to be?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
He is the Sonne of God the Father: altogither as mighty, as wiſe as good as the Father, which Sōne of God became man for vs in the wombe of the gloriouſe Virgine
Mary, by the worke of the holy Ghoſt.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What other thinge hath Chriſt done for vs?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He was borne of the ſame Virgin Mary, ſhe remaining a Virgin before her childbirth, in her childbirth, and after her childbirth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: And what more?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He was crucified dead and buried deſcended into hell, the third day he roſe againe from the dead. He aſcended into heauen and ſitteth at the right hand of God the Father almighty, as his ſonne: and frō thence he ſhall come to iudge the quicke and the dead, for to render to euery one according to his workes.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Do you beleue in the holy ghoſt?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Yea forſooth, for he is trew God, and the third perſon of the moſt holy Trinitye: whoe geueth his
grace and his giftes to the holy Catholicke Church.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is the holye Catholicke Church?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It is the wholle congregation of the faithfull Chriſtians, who haue and confeſſe the faith of Ieſus Chriſt: the head of which Church is Chriſt him ſelfe, and the Pope his Vicar on earth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What good haue we in the Church?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: This: that we are partakers of all the ſacrifices, Sacramentes, and good workes which are donne therin: And we haue the remiſſiō of ſinnes, with many other graces and giftes of God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is the reſurrection of the fleſhe, and the life euerlaſting?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
It is, that at the day of iudgement euery one ſhall riſe againe with the very ſame body & ſoule: and
the good ſhall go into euerlaſting life, for to ſee & enioy God: and the euell vnto Hell, with the Deuells.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who goeth to the paines of Purgatory?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The ſoules of thoſe which dye in the grace of God, and haue not fully ſatisfied for their ſinnes: and after that they haue ſuffered the dew puniſhmēts they ſhall go to heauen.

div.head: OF the ſecond thing neceſſary for a Chriſtian that is, of Hope. Chap. 5.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you looke to haue by Hope in God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
The life euerlaſting: which principally is obteined by the grace of
God, and beſides, by the merittes which through the ſame grace proceed from vs.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For to obteine that which wee hope for, what is required?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Amongſt other thinges, Prayer.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What prayers doth the Chruch teach vs?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Pater noſter, the Aue Mary, and the Salue Regina, and others.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the Pater noſter.

sp.speaker: D.

p.hi: 1 Pater noſter qui es in coelis: ſancti ficetur nomen tuum.
2 Adueniat regnum tuum.
3 Fiat voluntas tua, ſicut in coelo, et in terra.
4 Panem noſtrum quotidianum da nobis hodie.
5 Et dimitte nobis debita noſtra, ſicut et nos dimittimus debitoribus noſtris.
6 Et ne nos inducas in tentationem.
7 Sed libera nos a malo. Amen.

sp.p: Our Father which art in Heauen
1 Hallowed be thy name.
2 Thy kingdome come.
3 Thy will be done in earth, as it is in heauen.
4 Giue vs this day our daily bread.
5 And forgiue vs our treſpaſſes, as we forgiue them that treſpaſſe againſt vs.
6 And lead vs not into temptation.
7 But deliuer vs from euell. Amen.

div.head: OF the Pater noſter. Chap. 6

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What haue we ſaied?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Pater noſter.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who made it?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Our Lord Ieſus Chriſt: & he ſpoke it with his moſt holy mouth and
gaue it to his Diſciples and therfore it is the moſt excellent of all praiers.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do we aske in this praier?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Firſt we aske the glory of God, and than our owne good for our ſoule, and body, and that he will deliuer vs from all euell.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With whome do we ſpeake therin?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: With our Lord God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Where is God?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He is in euery place: but he is ſaid principally to be in heauē: where he doth manifeſt him ſelfe vnto the Bleſſed.

div.head: OF the Aue Mary. Chap. 7

p.hi:
Aue Maria gratia plena, Dominus tecum. Benedicta tu in mulieribus:
et benedictus fructus ventris tui, Ieſus. Sancta Maria, mater Dei, ora pro nobis peccatoribus nūc et in hora mortis noſtrae. Amen.

q.p: Haile Mary, full of grace, our Lord is with thee, bleſſed arte thou among women, and bleſſed is the fruite of thy wombe, Ieſus. Holy Mary, mother of God, pray for vs ſinners, now, and in the houre of our death. Amen.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What haue we ſaied?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Aue Mary.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who made it?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Angell Gabriel, when he came to ſalute our Lady: wherunto are adioined ſome wordes of S. Elizabeth and of the Church.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: With whome do we ſpeake in the Aue Mary?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: With our Lady.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do you beleeue our Lady to be?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: She is mother of God, a Virgin, full of grace, and of all vertew: Queene of heauen, and of earth, and our aduocate.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Where is our Lady?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: She is in heauen.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What ſay you of her which is in the Church?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: That is the Image of her which is in heauen, for to put vs in mind of her: and becauſe it is her image, we do reuerence vnto it, in honour of her ſelfe.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: As there are many Images of our Lady, be there alſo many Ladies?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: No forſooth: but one only which is in heauen: whome thoſe Images doe repreſent which are on earth.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Why than is ſhee called, our Lady of Pity, of Remedy, of Conſolation and in other like ſorte?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
For the many and diuerſe benefittes
which ſhe doth vs.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do we ſay to her in the Aue Mary?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: We ſalute her and praiſe her recommending our ſelues vnto her.

div.head: OF the Salue Regina. Chap. 8.
div.q: SAlue Regina, mater miſericordiae, vita, dulcedo, et ſpes noſtra, ſalue: Ad te clamamus, exules, filij Euae: Ad te ſuſpiramus, gementes, et flentes, in hac lachrimarū valle. Eia ergo aduocata noſtra, illos tuos miſericordes oculos ad nos conuerte. Et Ieſum benedictum fructum ventris tui nobis poſt hoc exilium oſtende. O clemens: Opia: O dulcis Virgo Maria. Ora pro nobis ſancta Dei genetrix: vt digni efficiamur promiſſionibus Chriſti.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What haue we ſaied?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The Salue Regina.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who taught it vs?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Our holy mother the Church.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: To whome do we ſpeake?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: With the ſame Virgin Mary.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What do we ſay vnto her in it?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Other praiſes of the ſame Virgin, demaunding with all her holy fauour and helpe.

div.head: OF other praiers and inuocation of Saintes. Chap. 9.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: After the Virgin Mary haue you deuotion to other Saintes?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Yea forſooth, vnto all, as vnto the frendes of God, and our interceſſours in heauen: but eſpecially vnto my Agnell keeper, and vnto the Saint of my name.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: And vnto the Relickes of Saints?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: I honour them alſo, becauſe they haue bene the temple of the holy Ghoſt, and are to be reunited to their gloriouſe ſoules.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What Prayer do you make vnto them?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Thoſe which the Church doth teach vs, & alſo for their honour, and that they may pray for me, I ſay the Pater noſter and Aue Mary.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What doe you whan you go to bedd?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Two thinges. Firſt, hauing made the ſigne of the Croſſe, I examine my conſcience. Secondlye I ſay the generall Confeſſion, the Pater noſter, and the Aue Mary, and other my deuotions.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: How do you examine your conſcience?

div.head: OF the examining of our Conſcience.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Firſt I thanke God for the benefitts receiued, eſpecially that day.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What more?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Than I thinke of my ſinnes, eſpecially of that day, being ſory for them, with purpoſe of amending and of confeſſing them.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What than?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Finally, I aske God pardon, and make a firme purpoſe of ſinning no more.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: And what do you the mornings?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Three things. Firſt, I thanke God that he hath kept me that night, and for his other benefitts.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is the ſecond thing you do?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: I offer him my body and ſoule.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is the third?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
I beſeech him that whatſoeuer I ſhall do may be for his holy ſeruice:
and alſo I ſay other my deuotions mentall and vocall: that is, with the minde, and with the voice.

div.head: OF the third thing neceſſary for a Chriſtian which is Charity. Chap. 10.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Which is the third thing neceſſary for a Chriſtian?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Charity.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Whome ought we to loue with charity?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: God aboue all thinges, and our neighbour as our ſelues, for the loue of God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: How ſhall we loue our neighbour as our ſelues?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Deſiring for him, and doing vnto him, that which we would for our
ſelues, according vnto reaſon, and the law of God.

div.head: OF the fourth thing neceſſary for a Chriſtian that is of good workes. Chap. 11.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Which is the fourth thing neceſſary for a Chriſtian?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Good workes. for after that one is come to the yeares of diſcretiō, faith is not ſufficiēt without good workes.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What good workes are theſe?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Thoſe which are ordained in the tenne commaundements of God, and in the other of the Church, with the workes of mercy, and of other vertewes.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the tenne Commandements.

q.p: 1 I am thy Lord God. Thou ſhalt haue no other Gods but me.
2 Thou ſhalt not take the name of God in vaine.
3 Remēber to ſanctifie the holy daies.
8 Thou ſhalt not beare falſe witneſſe.
9 Thou ſhalt not deſire thy neighbours wife.
10 Thou ſhalt not deſire thy neighbours goods.

div.head: AN expoſition of the ten Commaundements. Chap. 12.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Where did God geue theſe tenne Commaundements?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Firſt in the ould lawe. and afterwards
Chriſt our Lord confirmed them in the new.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is conteined in them?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: The three firſt, of worſhiping one God, of not taking his name in vaine, and of ſanctifying the holy daies: do apperteine to the honor of God. becauſe he is to be honoured, firſt, with the hart, than with the tongue, and with deeds.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: And the other ſeuen?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: They apperteine to the profitt of our neighbour.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Theſe tenne commaundements in how many are they comprehended?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: In the two precepts of Charity: that is, to loue God aboue all thinges, and our neighbour as our ſelues.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
So that the wholle law of God is comprehended in this ſweet precepte of loue, which our Lorde
graunt vs for his infinite goodnes. Amen.

div.head: OF the Commaundements of the Church. Chap. 13.

p.hi: Say the Commaundements of the Church.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: 1 To heare Maſſe on the holy daies commaunded,
2 To faſt the Lent and other daies commaunded, and to abſtaine from fleſh on the accuſtomed daies.
3 To go to Confeſſion▪ at the leaſt, once a yeare.
4 To Receaue at the leaſt at Eaſter.
5 To pay tithes.

div.head: OF the ſeuen Capitall ſinnes, which are called mortall. Chap. 14.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: We haue ſpoken of the good workes which are to be donne. Say now the euell which muſt be ſhunned: and firſt of the ſeuen ſinnes, which are called mortall.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Theſe are cauſe and heades of all other, and therfore are called Capitall: although ſometimes they may be veniall.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is Sinne?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It is that which is thought, ſpokē, or donne contrary to the law and will of God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What harme doth mortall ſinne to the ſinner?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It maketh him looſe God and his grace, and the glory which was promiſed him: & maketh him dettour of the euerlaſting paine of Hell.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Why is it called mortall?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Becauſe it killeth the ſoule, making it to looſe the life of grace.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What doth veniall ſinne?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It cauſeth not the loſſe of Gods grace, neither deſerueth hell: but it maketh a man to waxe colde in the loue and ſeruice of God, and meriteth temporall puniſhment, and diſpoſeth alſo vnto mortall ſinne.

div.head: OF the ſeuen Sacramēts of our holy mother the Church. Chap. 15.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What other thing is neceſſary for vs?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
It is neceſſary that we know the holy Sacraments, and that we receiue them in dew time whā our holy mother the Church ſo commaundeth
and declareth vnto vs.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For what end?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: For the blotting out of our ſinnes and the obteining Gods grace, and helpe for the doing of good workes.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
Say the Sacraments of our holy mother the Church.
1 Baptiſme
2 Confirmatiō
3 Euchariſt
4 Penance
5 Extreme vnction
6 Holy orders
7 Matrimony.

div.head: AN expoſition of ſome Sacraments. Chap. 16.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who hath ordained theſe Sacraments?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Our Lord Ieſus Chriſt.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Wherfore?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
For to geue vs pardon of our ſinns and to communicate vnto vs his grace, and the meritts of his paſſion.
and in euery one there is geuen grace for ſome particuler thing, but it is required that we receiue them worthely.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What effect hath the Sacrament of Baptiſme?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It maketh vs Chriſtians, and the chrildren of God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: How is this brought to paſſe?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Becauſe we are all borne in original ſinne: which togither with all other ſinnes cōmitted before Baptiſme, is taken away by the ſame: and there is geuen vs Gods grace and other his giftes: And ſo we are made children of God, and heires of euerlaſting life.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For what effect ſerueth the Sacrament of Confeſſion or Penance?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: That God our Lord may pardon our ſinnes which we haue donne after Baptiſme.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p:
How muſt he prepare him ſelfe,
that will be confeſſed?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: He muſt do three thinges. Firſt, he muſt procure with diligence to to call to mind his ſinnes cōmitted.
Secondly, to haue ſorow and repentance with purpoſe of ſinning no more.
Thirdly, he muſt make a full confeſſion of them all, and fulfill his penance geuen him by his Confeſſour.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For what effect ſerueth the ſacrament of the Aultar?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Firſt, that our ſoule may be nouriſhed and fedd with the grace of God and vnited vnto him.
Secondly, that we fall not eaſely into ſinne.
Thirdly, for to obteine all perfection.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Who is in the Bleſſed Sacrament?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
Ieſus Chriſt our Lorde: in body,
ſoule, and Godhead, euen as he is in heauen: as well in the hoſte, as in the chalice: after the conſecratiō of the Prieſt, which is made in the Maſſe.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: What is the Maſſe?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: It is a memory and trew repreſentation of the life, paſſion, & death of our Lord Ieſus Chriſt. and it is with all a Sacrifice where Chriſt him ſelfe is offered for the quicke and the dead. And therfore we muſt be preſent therat, with great deuotion and attention.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: How muſt one prepare him ſelfe to receaue worthely the Bleſſed Sacrament?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: By going with deuotion without conſcience of mortall ſinne, and being firſt confeſſed.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: For what effectes do the other ſacraments ſerue?

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p:
For to receiue diuerſe graces of
God, for that end, for the which they were ordained.

div.head: OF the other things which appertaine to the Chriſtian doctrine, or vnto good workes. Chap. 17.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the other thinges which belong to good workes, or to the Chriſtian doctrine, and firſt the three theologicall vertewes.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: Faith, Hope, and Charity.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the fower Cardinall vertewes

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the ſeuen giftes of the holy Ghoſt.

list.item: 7 And the gifte of the feare of God.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the eight Beatitudes.

sp.speaker: D.
sp.p: 1 Bleſſed are the poore of ſpirite, for theirs is the kingdome of heauen.
2 Bleſſed are the meeke: for they ſhall poſſeſſe the earth.
3 Bleſſed are they that mourne: for they ſhall be comfourted.
4 Bleſſed are they that hunger & thirſt after Iuſtice, for they ſhall haue their fill.
5 Bleſſed are the mercifull: for they ſhall obtaine mercy.
6 Bleſſed are the cleane of hart, for they ſhall ſee God.
7 Bleſſed are the peace-makers, for they ſhall be called the children of God.
8 Bleſſed are they that ſuffer perſecution for Iuſtice, for theirs is the Kingdome of heauen.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the twelue fruites of the holy Ghoſt.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the ſeuen workes of mercy corporall.

list.item: 2 To geue drinke to the thirſty.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the ſeuen workes of mercy ſpirituall.

list.item: 1 To geue good Counſell to other.
6 To beare patiently the troubleſomnes of others.
7 To pray for the quicke and dead.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the fifteene miſteries of the life of our Lord Ieſus Chriſt, for to meditate and ſay the Roſary of our Lady.
And firſt the fiue ioyfull.

list.item: 1 The Annunciation of our Lady whan the Sonne of God was conceiued.
3 The natiuity of our Lorde Ieſus Chriſt.
4 The Preſentation of our Lord in the Temple.
5 Whā our Lord was found againe in the Temple amongſt the Doctours.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say now the fiue ſorowfull.

list.item: 1 The Prayer of our Lorde in the garden.
3 The Crowning with a crowne of thornes.
4 The carying of the Croſſe vnto Mount Caluary.
5 The crucifying and Death of the Croſſe.

sp.speaker: M.
sp.p: Say the fiue gloriouſe.

list.item: 3 The comming of the holy Ghoſt.
5 Her Coronation aboue all Angells and Saintes.

div.p:
Whan it ringeth to the Aue Mary, we may obtaine Indulgence by ſaying:
At the firſt toll. Angelus Domini runciauit Mariae et concepit de ſpiritu ſancto.
Aue Maria. &c.
At the ſecond toll. Ecce Ancilla Domini, fiat mihi ſecundum verbum tuum.
Aue Maria. &c.
At the third toll. Et verbum caro factum eſt, et habitauit in nobis.
Aue Maria. &c.

div.head: Oremus.
div.p:
GRatiam tuam quaſumus Domine mētibus noſtris infunde, vt qui Angelo nunciante Chriſti filij tui incarnationem
cognouimus: per Paſſionem eius et crucem ad Reſurrectionis gloriam perducamur: Per eundem Chriſtum Dominum noſtrum. Amen.

div.head: A Praier before ſtudy.
div.p: CLementiſſime Pater, infunde nobis per meritū Ieſu Chriſti filij tui Spiritus ſancti gratiam, qua intellectus noſter liberalibus diſciplinis plenius illuſtre tur, quas in diuinum tuum honorem aliquando, et noſtram ſpiritualem vtilitatem conuertere poſſimus. Per Chriſtum Dominum noſtrum. Amen.
